paper_abstract: In a graph, an induced path is a path v(0), v(1), . . . , v(r) in which a vertex v(i) is adjacent to another vertex v(j) if and only if vertical bar i - j vertical bar = 1. An induced-path partition of a graph is a collection of vertex-disjoint induced paths that cover all vertices of the graph. The induced-path-partition problem is to determine the minimum cardinality of an induced-path partition of a graph. This paper presents an O(vertical bar V vertical bar+vertical bar E vertical bar)-time algorithm for the induced-path-partition problem on graphs whose blocks are complete graphs, cycles or complete bipartite graphs. (c) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Induced-path partition on graphs with special blocks
